title: DS 201: Introduction to Data Science
text:
Welcome to the course website for DS 201: Introduction to Data Science for Fall 2023.
This course is offered at the University of Scranton and is being taught by Jason M. Graham (Mathematics Department) during the Fall 2023 semester.

title: Syllabus
text:
Required Readings

Hands-On Programming with R by Garrett Grolemund, freely available online here.
R for Data Science by Hadley Wickham & Garrett Grolemund, freely available online here.
Data Science: A First Introduction by Tiffany Timbers, Trevor Campbell, and Melissa Lee, freely available online here.
Telling Stories with Data by Rohan Alexander, freely available online here.

title: Syllabus
text:
Additional References

An Introduction to Statistical Learning 2nd Ed. by James, Witten, Hastie, and Tibshirani, freely available online here.
Tree-Based Methods for Statistical Learning by Brandon M. Greenwell, freely available online here.

title: Syllabus
text:
Recommended Readings

Data Visualization A Practical Introduction by Healy, freely available online here.
Statistical Inference via Data Science A ModernDive into R and the Tidyverse by Chester Ismay & Albert Y. Kim, freely available online here.
An Introduction to Statistical Learning 2nd Ed. by James, Witten, Hastie, and Tibshirani, freely available online here.
Tree-Based Methods for Statistical Learning by Brandon M. Greenwell, freely available online here.
Advanced R by Wickham, freely available online here.
R Packages by Wickham, freely available online here.

title: Links
text:
Tidy Tuesday data repository, link here.
The R Graph Gallery, link here.
From Data to Viz website on visualizing data, link here.

title: Links
text:
Texts

Spatial Data Science with applications in R available here.
Deep Learning and Scientific Computing with R torch available here.
Analyzing US Census Data: Methods, Maps, and Models in R textbook available here.
Tidy Finance with R available here.
Outstanding User Interfaces with Shiny textbook available here.
Crime by the Numbers: A Criminologist’s Guide to R textbook available here.
